intro: Hypocalymma inopinatum, commonly known as the narrow-leafed mistflower, is a flowering plant native to south-eastern Australia. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family and is characterized by its small, white or pale yellow flowers that appear in clusters. The plant has narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, silky hair. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open forests and woodlands. Hypocalymma inopinatum is an important nectar source for native bees and other pollinators.
